Entries.Entry: You're the new gal who moved into that farm down the way, right?<wait><page> Ah, so your name is <playername>?<wait><page> Hi. I'm Rick. I live in town with my mom and my little sister, Popuri.<wait><page> It's good to meet you.<wait>

You're the new guy who moved into that farm down the way, right?<wait><page> Ah, so your name's <playername>?<wait><page> Hi. I'm Rick. I live in town with my mom and my little sister, Popuri.<wait><page> It's good to meet you.<wait>
Wow, thanks! That's my <nickname>.<wait><page> I knew you'd remember my birthday.<wait>
Oh, wow! Thanks! Today's my birthday, even!<wait>
Wow, thanks! This is my most favorite food, too.<wait><page> You're so considerate, <nickname>. Boy, now I'm going to have to get something for you. Hmm...what would be good?<wait>
Thanks! I really like everything egg and egg-adjacent, and not just because I grew up on a chicken farm.<wait><page> This is a particular favorite of mine.<wait>
Ooh! Thanks. You know me so well, <nickname>.<wait><page> I certainly picked the right girl to marry, huh?<wait>
Ooh! Thanks. You know me so well, <nickname>.<wait><page> I certainly picked the right guy to marry, huh?<wait>
Ooh! Thanks. It's so nice of you to get a present for me, <playername>.<wait>
Ooh! Thanks. It's so nice of you to get a present for me, <playername>.<wait>
Ooh! Thanks, <nickname>. Even now that we're married, you're still as sweet as ever. I appreciate the present.<wait>
Ooh! Thanks, <nickname>. Even now that we're married, you're still as sweet as ever. I appreciate the present.<wait>
Ooh, is this for me? Great! I can really use this. Thanks.<wait>
Ooh, is this for me? Thanks, <nickname>.<wait>
Ooh, is this for me? Thanks.<wait>
Er... Don't get me wrong, I'm always grateful for the thought behind any present you give me, <nickname>...<wait><page> But, uh, I'd appreciate it if you picked something else next time.<wait>
Um...thanks? I guess?<wait>
WHAT THE FLAP?! EW! Not that! Of all things, not that! What the heck were you thinking, <nickname>?!<wait>
EGG-SCUSE ME?! EW! Are you really giving this to me?! What the heck were you thinking?<wait>
They're so dang cute. I swear, I get the warm fuzzies every time I see them. Don't you, <nickname>?<wait>
Man, they're SO cute!<wait>
<nickname>, don't take that anywhere near our coop, please and thanks. You'll send the chickens into a frenzy.<wait>
I try to keep all other animals out of our chicken coop. The chickens panic and stress out if they get too close.<wait>
Oh, that's pretty. If you don't want it, <nickname>, I'll give it to Mom.<wait>
Oh, that's pretty. I don't really need it myself, but I bet Mom would love it.<wait>
Is that yours, <nickname>? Neat!<wait><page> I wouldn't use it myself. Maybe I should give it to Mom?<wait>
Huh? This is for me? To be honest, I don't have much use for it.<wait><page> I wonder if Mom would like it...<wait>
Sorry, I tend not to wear this sort of thing. Haven't I told you that before?<wait>
Sorry, I tend not to wear this sort of thing. Just FYI for next time.<wait>
Uh...thanks, <nickname>. But you DO remember today's the day for guys to give presents to girls, right...?<wait>
Uh...thanks, <nickname>. I guess this IS the right occasion to be handing out presents.<wait>
Uh...thanks. But you DO remember that today's supposed to be the girls' turn to receive presents, right...?<wait>
You're sure it's okay for me to have this? Thanks!<wait>
Wow. Even now that we're married, you still remembered to get me a Valentine's Day present. Thanks, <nickname>.<wait>
Wow. Even now that we're married, you still remembered to get me a Valentine's Day present. Thanks, <nickname>.<wait>
Ooh, thanks!<wait><page> I didn't get you anything for White Day, yet you still got something for me. I almost feel guilty accepting it. Thanks!<wait>
Hm? Oh, you remembered that I got you something for White Day and wanted to give me something in return?<wait><page> Thanks! That's so kind of you.<wait>

Huh? What? Come again? Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on a minute, <playername>.<wait>
I don't think we should be having this conversation here. Let's go to your place.<wait>
Huh? What? Come again? Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on a minute, <playername>.<wait>
I don't think we should be having this conversation here. Let's go to your place.<wait>
Huh? I-Is that what I think it is?! Well, I'll be a chicken's uncle...<wait><page> Uh, yeah, I don't think we should have this conversation here. Let's go to your place.<wait>
Huh? I-Is that what I think it is?! Well, I'll be a chicken's uncle...<wait><page> Uh, yeah, I don't think we should have this conversation here. Let's go to your place.<wait>
Wow, you're getting married? Congrats! I bet it'll be a big help having another person around your farm, huh?<wait>
Ah. A Preserved Flower. For me, I assume?<wait><page> Um... I'm really flattered you feel that way, but I'm afraid we aren't quite on the same page.<wait>
Um... I'm flattered you'd offer, really, but I think it's a bit too soon for us. Sorry.<wait>
Hey, this is just the latest scuttlebutt, but a farm over in Forgotten Valley is supposed to have a lot of animals.<wait><page> You keep trying your hardest too, <nickname>.<wait>
Hey, this is just the latest scuttlebutt, but a farm over in Forgotten Valley is supposed to have a lot of animals.<wait><page> You keep trying your hardest too, <playername>.<wait>
Hey, this is just the latest scuttlebutt, but a farm over in Forgotten Valley is supposed to have a lot of animals.<wait><page> You keep trying your hardest too, <playername>.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. You know tomorrow is Starlight Night, right?<wait><page> My family will be throwing a little party to mark the occasion. You can come too, if you like.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. You know tomorrow is Starlight Night, right?<wait><page> My family will be throwing a little party to mark the occasion. You can come too, if you like.<wait>
The party don't start till I walk in!
Sorry. I can't make it.
So you'll come? Cool! Plan to arrive at my place by 6:00 PM, then. We'll be waiting for you.<wait>
Really? Aw, that's too bad. I guess you DO have all your farm work to think of. Oh well.<wait>
We'll be throwing a little party for Starlight Night tomorrow. Be sure you're home by 6:00 PM, okay?<wait>

Man, to think our baby is right here in your tummy, turning into more of a little person every single day.<wait><page> It's crucial for you to take care of yourself now. Promise me you won't stay out late and get a chill, okay?<wait>

Do you have morning sickness at all? I hear that's supposed to be rough. <wait><page> As a guy, I can't even begin to imagine how uncomfortable that must be. I'm on call if you need anything, okay?<wait>
You're looking a lot better now. Is the baby moving around at all?<wait>
If you feel something, let me know, okay? I wonder if we're in for a son or a daughter...<wait><page> If it's a girl, I think you should be the one to name her, <nickname>.<wait>
How are you feeling? You aren't too tired or anything, are you?<wait>
I hear it's good for you to get a little bit of exercise during pregnancy. Man, I can't wait to be a dad!<wait>
The baby is supposed to arrive tomorrow, right? I've asked Elly and Doctor to come over, just in case.<wait>
I'll spend all day at home with you tomorrow, okay? And you should probably get to sleep early tonight, too.<wait>
Eyelids...heavy... Sheesh. I guess sleepless nights are just part and parcel of raising an infant, huh?<wait>
Eesh. Our little one doesn't sleep for more than a few hours at a time, so we can't either. Are you holding up okay?<wait>
Our baby really has my eyes, wouldn't you say? I think somebody is going to grow up to look a lot like Papa!<wait>
Our baby's eyes really resemble mine, huh? I hope our little one will grow up to take after the both of us!<wait>
I just can't take my eyes off of our baby. So precious. I think we've got a little weight gain going on, too.<wait>
Agh, so cute! It's really fun to watch a child grow. ∀<wait>
I wonder what we should do tomorrow? Geez, even at work, I can't stop thinking about our baby.<wait>
<nickname>, you aren't too tired, are you? Are you feeling okay?<wait>
I imagine it's hard to be on your feet. I'm tired just watching you! Why don't you rest and let me handle things?<wait>

It feels like babies grow so quickly. Doesn't it seem that way to you too?<wait><page> I wonder what sort of person <childname> will grow up to be. The anticipation is killing me. Okay, bad word choice...<wait>
Oh, but aren't girls supposed to be more rebellious towards their dads? Oof, I hope that never happens with ours...<wait>
Sorry. For some reason, I'm just not in the mood to chat today.<wait>
Could you give me some space, please?<wait>
Good morning, <nickname>. Been really busy as of late?<wait>
Hey, um... I know this will probably seem like it's coming out of nowhere, but...I miss you.<wait>
Is it me, or have we not talked all that much lately? Maybe...maybe it IS just me. I hope.<wait>
If you don't set aside more time for us to spend together as a couple, then I'm not sure I know why we're still married.<wait>
If you don't set aside more time for us to spend together as a couple, then I'm not sure I know why we're still married.<wait>
Good morning. Did you sleep well? You aren't stressing yourself out too much, are you?<wait>
I don't mean to make assumptions about what you can and can't handle, but I'm worried for you.<wait>
How have you been feeling? You aren't overworking yourself, I hope?<wait>
Try not to work too much after midnight, okay?<wait>
Morning, <nickname>. Let's both hit today with everything we've got. Come see me over at the chicken farm, too.<wait>
<nickname>, you doing okay on your own? Just say the word if you need anything. Remember, you aren't alone anymore. ∀<wait>
So, how was your day? It's important for a couple to have good communication, y'know. ∀<wait>
So, how was your day? It's important for a couple to have good communication, y'know. ∀<wait>
There's no rush, though. We're going to be together for a long, looong time.<wait>
Morning, <nickname>. ∀ Let's both give it our best out there, okay? It's a new day full of exciting potential.<wait>
Morning, <nickname>. ∀ Let's both give it our best out there, okay? It's a new day full of exciting potential.<wait>
With you in my corner, <nickname>, I feel like I can do anything. I feel so lucky to be your husband. ∀<wait>
With you in my corner, <nickname>, I feel like I can do anything. I feel so lucky to be your husband. ∀<wait>
How is the farm doing? Let me know if there's anything I can do to help out.<wait>
I'm probably stating the obvious, but I think you're most in your element with your sleeves rolled up on the farm.<wait>
Oh, hey, <nickname>. Here to do some shopping?<wait><page> Remember, you're driving for two right now. Take it easy, okay?<wait>
What's that?<wait><page> You think I'm taking this whole fatherhood thing a little too seriously? Heh. I'll take that as a compliment.<wait>
Hey, <nickname>. What's up?<wait>
Oh, uh, I was just wondering if anything was going on with <childname>, so I came to check. Can Papa have a little visit?<wait>
Oh, uh... Hey, <nickname>.<wait>
Could you give me a little breathing room for a minute? I'm thinking about something.<wait>
Oh. Hey, <nickname>. Something up?<wait>
If you don't need me for anything, could you leave me alone, please?<wait>
Hey, what's up? Come to check on the chickens?<wait>
Or are you here to check up on me instead? I'm doing just fine. Everything's peachy keen.<wait>
Hey, <nickname>. How's the farm?<wait>
It's such a relief knowing home is just a short jaunt away. If anything happens, I can run straight there.<wait>
Oh, hey, <nickname>. So you came to see me, huh? Aww. Make yourself at home.<wait>
Man, uh, it still makes my cheeks a little flushed, meeting like this somewhere other than home.<wait>
Hey, how's it going? Everything's great on my end.<wait>
Apparently, Mom has been waiting ages for me and Karen to get married, and for her to move in with us.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. How's it going? Things are great on my end.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. How's it going? Things are great on my end.<wait>
Man, marriage is SO worth it. It has been such a relief to have Karen in my corner.<wait>
Hey. Don't forget to drop by my store sometimes, too. My chickens lay the best eggs around.<wait>
My childhood friend works over at the General Store. Her name's Karen. She's a really nice gal.<wait><page> Have you met her yet?<wait>
Phew! Feeding all these chickens day in and day out is a lot of work.<wait>
It'd be so much easier if Dad came back home to help.<wait>
Karen's a heck of a friend. We can talk to each other about anything. I mean, we've been together since we were kids.<wait>
Back then, I pretty much played with her and her alone.<wait><page> We had so much fun goofing around together...<wait>
Y'know, recently, I've started to realize just how important Karen really is to me.<wait>
It's still too embarrassing to tell her that, though. Promise me you'll keep this a secret! Please?<wait>
It's still too embarrassing to tell her that, though. Promise me you'll keep this a secret! Please?<wait>
It's weird. For some reason, Karen has been awfully quiet as of late. She's usually on my case about SOMETHING...<wait>

No one understands me quite like Karen does. Not even Popuri, if I'm being honest.<wait><page> She's my sister, sure, but she's always snippy with me, telling me to shut up or leave her alone. It's a shame.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. What's up?<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. What's up?<wait>
We really are getting married, aren't we? You and me. Married. ∀<wait><page> You're going to wear a wedding dress and everything. I can't wait to see it.<wait>
We really are getting married, aren't we? You and me. Married. ∀<wait><page> You're going to wear a nice tuxedo and everything. I can't wait to see it.<wait>
Hey. How's the farm doing? It's business as usual over here. Our chickens are happy and thriving.<wait>
It takes a lot of strength to start from nothing and make it into something, I bet.<wait>
Hey, how's it going? Getting used to all your farm chores?<wait>
Let me know if you need anything. We're neighbors now, after all.<wait>
Hi, <playername>.<wait>
Hi, <playername>.<wait>
We grind our chickens' feed with our water mill. I'm pretty sure you ought to have one on your farm, too, <playername>.<wait>
We grind our chickens' feed with our water mill. I'm pretty sure you ought to have one on your farm, too, <playername>.<wait>
Chickens may look the same at a glance, but if you look closely, you'll start noticing all their little differences.<wait>
...You still can't tell? Huh. I guess it's harder for some people than others. I'll teach you a trick or two later.<wait>
...You still can't tell? Huh. You know how some people have face blindness? Maybe that's you, but with chickens.<wait>
Man, caring for a life is a lot of hard work and responsibility. I'm sure I'm preaching to the choir, <playername>.<wait>
Man, caring for a life is a lot of hard work and responsibility. I'm sure I'm preaching to the choir, <playername>.<wait>
But y'know? Watching them every day, you get to know each one of them and their adorable quirks. It's never boring.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. How's the farm?<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. How's the farm?<wait>
It's amazing how you manage to run that huge farm all by yourself, <playername>. I really respect that.<wait>
It's amazing how you manage to run that huge farm all by yourself, <playername>. I really respect that.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. How's it going?<wait>
Hey, <playername>. How's it going?<wait>
I have a lot of respect for you, <playername>.<wait><page> In fact, I don't think I've ever had as much respect for someone as I do for you.<wait>
I have a lot of respect for you, <playername>.<wait><page> In fact, I don't think I've ever had as much respect for someone as I do for you.<wait>
It's funny. Without Karen around, I feel like I'm floundering. I'd better head home as soon as I can.<wait>
Karen's an only child, so I bet Jeff gets really lonely not having her around the house anymore.<wait><page> Not that Sasha doesn't look for any excuse she can to come visit us, either.<wait>
Oh, hey. It's gotten pretty dark out, hasn't it?<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. Mom asked me to do some shopping for her.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. Mom asked me to do some shopping for her.<wait>
Hey, I like to kick back and relax every once in a while too, y'know. I'm not THAT much of an old man at heart.<wait>
Ugh, it's summer again. That flake Kai is going to drift in and start making moves on Popuri again, I just know it!<wait>

Honestly, it's half Popuri's fault too! She encourages him.<wait><page> She's so naïve that she has no clue just how untrustworthy that flake is.<wait><page> Tell her, <playername>. She'll never listen to me.<wait>
Popuri only comes home in the summer these days. I never thought I'd get this anxious for a season to come.<wait>
Mom is really happy that Popuri's home for a visit.<wait><page> I just wish she would stay home year-round.<wait>
Hey. Popuri seems really happy with her new life. She sends letters every week and comes to visit over the summer.<wait>

Of course, when she writes, she drones on and on about herself and that flake Kai.<wait><page> And he's ALWAYS with her when she visits in summer. Can't either of them spare a thought for poor ol' Rick?<wait>

I like pretty much everyone in town except for Kai. I can't stand that no-good bum.<wait><page> He drifts in like low tide in the summer, turns the town on its head, and then disappears whenever he pleases.<wait>

Mom and Popuri don't have so much as a single bad thing to say about Kai...<wait><page> But I'm not surprised, seeing how women seem to fawn all over him. That's another thing I don't like about him.<wait>
Hey, what's up? Come for a visit?<wait>
Man, hanging out in my old room is so relaxing. Visiting home really conjures up some warm, happy nostalgia.<wait>
Hey. The weather's pretty lousy today, isn't it?<wait>

On days like this, I always feel like even the chickens would tell me to take the day off if they could talk.<wait><page> I mean, they're all hunkered down in their coop, quietly resting. Nobody's trying to sneak out and run away.<wait>
Hey. What brings you out at a time like this?<wait>
Sure you shouldn't call it a day and head home?<wait><page> I mean, you ARE running that farm all by yourself. You need to get some rest when you have the chance.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. How's it going? Me? Couldn't be better.<wait>
It's nice to have a change of pace like this once in a while. Focus on nothing but work and you'll burn yourself out.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. How's it going? Me? Couldn't be better.<wait>
The General Store is closed on Tuesdays, so I don't have to run around like a chicken with its--er, bad word choice.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. Are you finished with your chores for today too? What say we go and get some drinks together?<wait>
I have to say, it's pretty hard to beat a night out for drinks with my wife.<wait>
I have to say, it's pretty hard to beat a night out for drinks with my husband.<wait>
Oh, hey, <playername>. Are you finished with your chores for today too?<wait>
Aaah. ♪ There's nothing like kicking back with a cool and refreshing drink after a hard day's work.<wait>
Hm? Oh, hey, <nickname>. Are you here to have your tools checked out? Me too.<wait>
They do really solid work here. Make sure you thank them for a job well done, okay? They deserve it.<wait>
Every Tuesday, I stop by the Forge and update Mr. Saibara on the condition of all my tools.<wait>
You use a lot of tools on your farm, right, <playername>? Does Mr. Saibara do maintenance on them for you too?<wait>
You use a lot of tools on your farm, right, <playername>? Does Mr. Saibara do maintenance on them for you too?<wait>
The Spring Derby is coming up. I look forward to it every year!<wait>
I wonder who's going to win the Spring Derby tomorrow... I can't wait to find out!<wait>
Hey! Are you going to take part in this year's Cluck-Cluck Clash?<wait>
If you're going to be participating in the Cluck-Cluck Clash, you can bet I'll be rooting you on louder than a rooster in the morning!<wait>
So... Are you going to enter a cow in the Moo-Moo Festival?<wait>
A cow raised with love and care is sure to rustle up a great score!<wait>
Ahh, I can't wait for the Fireworks Festival tomorrow. Who doesn't love a good fireworks show?<wait>
Moonlight Night's tomorrow. Let's hope the weather cooperates...<wait>
Will you be entering the Autumn Derby?<wait>
The Autumn Derby's tomorrow already, huh... I wonder who's going to win!<wait>
I can't wait to find out who's entering the Fluffy Festival this year!<wait>
If you want to win the Fluffy Festival, caring daily for your fleecy friends is imperative to success! Though I suppose that goes for all animals, huh?<wait>
Hmm? I don't think we've met. Well, hi! I'm Popuri! What's your name?<wait><page> Aah, <playername>, huh? It's nice to meet you.<wait>
Ooh, wow! You got a birthday present for me? Eee! Thanks so much, <nickname>! ∀<wait>
Ooh, wow! Is this for me? Guess what, didja know today's my birthday, too? Thanks so much! You're the best! ∀<wait>
Whaaa-- I-Is this really my birthday present? Wooow, I never thought I'd get something THIS nice!<wait><page> Thanks so much! I'll take good care of it.<wait>
Ooh, wow! Thanks! Didja know that today is my birthday? I'm so happy I get to celebrate it in summer. ∀<wait>
Huh? This is my birthday present? Really?<wait><page> Wooow! I bet Mom will be super surprised when I show her!<wait>
Awww! Thanks, <nickname>! I feel so lucky to have a wife like you. ∀<wait>
Awww! Thanks, <nickname>! I feel so lucky to have a husband like you. ∀<wait>
Ooh! Ooh! I love this so much! Thanks a bunch! ∀<wait>
Ooh! Thanks, <nickname>! ∀ I love this so much!<wait>
Ooh! Thanks, <nickname>! ∀ I love this so much!<wait>
Wow, thank you! I super like it!<wait>
Thaaank yooou, <nickname>! ♪ You know how to make a girl smile.<wait>
Thaaank yooou, <nickname>! ♪ You know how to make a girl smile.<wait>
Ooh, thanks!<wait>
Thanks, <nickname>!<wait>
Thanks!<wait>
Huh? For me? I thought you knew I hated this.<wait>
Ew! I hate this!<wait>
Ewww! <nickname>, you big dummy! Why would you try to give me something I hate? Take it back and throw it away!<wait>
Ew, gross! I don't want that!<wait>
Cuuute! I've played with chickens my whole life, so I like pretty much all animals.<wait>
Eeee! It's sooooo CUTE! ∀ ∀ ∀<wait>
EEK! NOOO! You big, dumb, stupid dummy! Get that thing away from me!<wait>
EEEEEK! That's scaaary!<wait>
Ooh, that's so neat! Wait...it's for me?<wait><page> Yaaay! Thanks so much! You're the greatest, <nickname>! I love you. ∀<wait>
Ooh, that's so neat! Wait...it's for me?<wait><page> Yaaay! Thanks so much! You're the greatest, <nickname>! I love you. ∀<wait>
Ooh, that's so neat! Wait...it's for me?<wait><page> Yaaay! Thanks so much! You're the greatest, <playername>! I love you. ∀<wait>
What, you're giving this to me?<wait><page> It's okay. Kai doesn't get mad if other boys give me presents. Thanks!<wait>
What, you're giving this to me? Yaaay! Boy, it's a really grown-up and mature kind of present, isn't it? ∀<wait>
Eee! This is super fantabulous! And you're giving it to me, right?<wait><page> Yaaay! Thanks so much! I really like it! <nickname>, you're the best. ∀<wait>
Eee! This is super fantabulous! And you're giving it to me, right?<wait><page> Yaaay! Thanks so much! I really like it! <nickname>, you're the best. ∀<wait>
Wooow, neato burrito! This is for me? Yaaay! Thanks so much!<wait><page> I really like it. <playername>, you're the best. ∀<wait>
Wooow, this is for me?<wait><page> It's okay. Kai doesn't get mad if other boys give me presents. Thanks!<wait>
Is this for me? Yaaay! Thanks! I'm gonna show it to Mom.<wait>
Ooh, is this for me? Wow! Thanks! Mmm, it smells so nice!<wait>
Kai gave me this perfume as a present too.<wait><page> At this rate, I'm going to be swimming in perfume. At least I'll smell good!<wait>
Hm? What's that? Ooh, perfume? What, and it's for me? Yay! Thanks.<wait>
Thanks. Um, you DO know today is White Day, right? ...You aren't re-gifting this to me, are you?<wait>
Thanks! You're such a nice and considerate person, <playername>.<wait>
Ooh, thanks! Mind if I get to snacking right away?<wait><page> Mmm! I've been looking forward to today for weeks!<wait>
Ooh, thanks! But, um, are you sure?<wait><page> I mean, I didn't get you anything for Valentine's Day.<wait>
Oh, is this for me? Thanks. You shouldn't have, really...<wait>
<playername>, what's wrong? You look super serious today.<wait>
Huh? Is...is that a Preserved Flower? Wow. I guess we have something really important to talk about, huh?<wait>
Oh, a Preserved Flower. I wonder if someone will give ME one someday. Hee hee. I sure hope so.<wait>
Um! W-Wait, <playername>! Can we go to your house real quick? Please?<wait>
Goodness! You surprised me. You know, you should only offer that to someone you really, REALLY want to marry.<wait>
I-Is that a Blue Feather? Um... I think it's a little too soon for us.<wait>
Oh! <playername>, guess what, guess what? Tomorrow's Starlight Night, right?<wait><page> Well, you can come celebrate with me and my family, if you want! You're invited!<wait>
Yaaay! I'm gonna make a whole bunch of really yummy food for all of us. Make sure you don't spoil your appetite!<wait>
Oh. I guess you're probably plenty busy, <playername>. If you can't come, that's okay.<wait>
Tomorrow's Starlight Night, so we're gonna be having a party.<wait><page> Guess what? Anna is teaching me a yummy new cake recipe! It's going to be amazing, just you wait. ∀<wait>
Hee hee. I knew something weird was going on. I'm just glad I'm not sick or anything.<wait>
Don't worry, I'm fine. The only thing that feels kinda strange is how hungry I am all the time.<wait>
Morning. ∀<wait><page> I was so worried I wasn't lying down in the right position for the baby that I couldn't sleep a wink.<wait>
Morning. ∀<wait><page> I was so worried I wasn't lying down in the right position for the baby that I couldn't sleep a wink.<wait>
It was so weird. Is it possible to be too happy to sleep? I guess so, huh?<wait>
I went to the Clinic and they said that the baby is growing just fine. I can't wait for them to be born.<wait>
But, um... I have to admit, I'm a little scared.<wait><page> Mom told me it really hurts a whole lot when a baby is being born.<wait>
Hmm...<wait>
<nickname>! Guess what, guess what? Tomorrow! The baby is gonna be born TOMORROW!<wait><page> I went to the Clinic today and Elly told me so!<wait>
Hee hee! Oh, aren't you just the cutest?<wait>

Remember that Fishing Rod I gave ya? It used to belong to a guy who lived with me. Went by the name'a Greg.<wait><page> Ain't nothin' Greg loved more than fishin'. Said he was gonna fish round the world one day, an' took off.<wait><page> Ain't seen 'im since. Wonder what he's up to nowadays.<wait>

We ended up knockin' back some drinks and chattin' 'til the wee hours. Then the ol' guy got talkin' about his past.<wait>

Manna loves the sound of her own voice, so it might be hard to actually, y'know, BUY something from her.<wait><page> But the reality is that she's just lonely, so I hope you'll forgive her.<wait>
Hey. How are things? Have you gotten used to your work?<wait><page> Well, pour yourself a drink of your preferred libation and take it easy, eh?<wait>
The human brain is simple, you know.<wait><page> Simple to trick, at least. If you convince yourself that something is good for you, you won't get sick from it.<wait>
We're eating out as a family today! We stopped doing this after Adge left.<wait>

We're going to Church with Cliff today. I'd never so much as set foot in there until recently.<wait><page> Turns out it's not so bad to have somewhere quiet and empty to clear your head every once in a while.<wait>
Hey. Did you come for a bite too, <playername>?<wait>
Manna? I have no idea what she's doing right now.<wait><page> Apparently, she'd rather gossip with the neighbors than cook for me. Figures.<wait>
You look like you're really busting your butt out there. Cliff is too, y'know.<wait>
Dudley's always going on about what a great guy Cliff is.<wait><page> Contrary to what you might expect, he's actually a pretty popular guy.<wait>
Good to see ya, <playername>! Are you done working?<wait>
I work myself to the bone every day too, you know. I've earned myself at least a small drink, wouldn't you say?<wait>
Now that Cliff's pitching in, my work is a lot easier than it used to be.<wait><page> I'm truly grateful to you for connecting us, <playername>.<wait>
Cliff's made no secret of the fact that he's thankful too.<wait><page> He was saying he probably wouldn't be here if he hadn't found this job.<wait>
Hey there, <playername>. What are you doing down here in the Cellar? We sell drinks at the house, not here.<wait>

Nice and cool down here, eh? And this is the only place you can hear the wine talk. It's alive, just like you or me.<wait><page> As long as I'm working here, I don't think I'll ever want to retire.<wait>
Once <childname> gets bigger, you're welcome to come by for a tour.<wait>
We may not be related by blood, but I think of <childname> as my own grandchild.<wait><page> Manna feels the same way, of course.<wait>
Oh, you're here too, <playername>? This place is pretty much the definition of "serene."<wait>
I always thought Church was a strict, suffocating place, but it turns out that's not true in the slightest.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. Y'know, as it turns out, Carter is a surprisingly decent guy.<wait>
Ever since Cliff came into our lives, I've changed my mind about a lot of things.<wait><page> Before, I'd just spend Saturdays in a semi-lucid haze. Now, well...<wait>
Wine comes down to the quality of the fruit used to make it. Period.<wait><page> The fruit I painstakingly raise always makes top-quality wine.<wait>
This Winery is named after my daughter.<wait><page> "Adge Winery," I call it. What do you think? A perfect name, right?<wait>

Hope you've gotten used to how much of a chatterbox Manna is... Well, have you?<wait><page> If you can tune out the petty stuff, listening to her should give you a solid sense of the town dynamics.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. Fancy having a glass of my favorite libation with me sometime?<wait><page> You know, now that I get a better look at you, you remind me of my daughter.<wait>
Hey, <playername>. Fancy having a glass of my favorite libation with me sometime?<wait><page> You know, now that I get a better look at you, you remind me of myself in my youth.<wait>
The Mochi Bonanza's tomorrow, huh? Count me in. I'll be eating my fill for sure.<wait>
What's that? You wanna know the odds for the Derby horses?<wait><page> You and me both, friend. You and me both...<wait>
I always get real worked up come Derby time. I look forward to 'em every year.<wait>
Will we be seeing any chickens of yours in this year's Cluck-Cluck Clash, <playername>?<wait>
The Cluck-Cluck Clash is tomorrow... It's a real lively little festival, so it's definitely a favorite of mine.<wait>
What's that? You wanna know the odds for the Derby horses?<wait><page> You and me both, friend. You and me both...<wait>
I always get real worked up come Derby time. I look forward to 'em every year.<wait>
Another year gone, eh? I'll drink to that.<wait>

My, my, my! I haven't seen you around before. Could you be...<playername>? Bingo! I just KNEW it! I heard from Thomas that someone new was moving to town, and he may or may not let your name slip, too. Hm? Me? Oh, where ARE my manners? My name is Manna. My husband Duke and I run this Vineyard. It's ever so nice to meet you. We may be out in the boonies, but the folks here are kind, so let us know if you're ever in a bind. Ooh, I'm a poet! Oh, whoops. Am I talking too much? I'm so sorry. Bad habit.<wait>
Goodness gracious, great balls of cowpat! Is that for me?! Oh, you're such a sweetheart! Unlike a certain husband of mine...<wait>

I can tell you right now exactly how this is all going to shake down. Duke's completely forgotten it's my birthday today and will come home after stuffing his face at the Inn. Waking up in a bloated haze, he'll forget how he got home and what he was doing.<wait>
Then he'll finally be like, "Oh no! Yesterday was Manna's birthday!"<wait>
He'll rush to the General Store, and even if it's Tuesday--you know, when they're usually closed--he'll beg Jeff:<wait>
"Give me anything here that would work as a present, stat!"<wait>
"On the double! I need it by YESTERDAY, pal! Chop chop!"<wait>
Or some such thing. And then he'll take that present, saunter up to me like he's had it all along... ...and hand it over with a dopey smile on his face, as if nothing had ever happened.<wait>
What will I do with it, you ask? Return it immediately, of course. For a full refund. Duke will have no clue what he even bought me, so he won't notice if I don't have it anymore.<wait>

Why, thank you! Do you always give such lovely gifts to the townspeople? If you're going to give gifts, you should give them out to everyone, you know. Bad rumors will start circulating if you're only generous with folks who are young, single, and ready to mingle. Well, to be honest, everyone likes you enough that you prooobably don't have to worry. But anyway, thank you. I love it!<wait>

Why, thank you. You're surprisingly conscientious. No, that wasn't a backhanded compliment. It's a good thing! Truly! I live with a pushy, insensitive oaf of a man like Duke, so... When I encounter folks like you, I can't help but compare them to my only frame of reference. Anyway, thank you so much.<wait>

Thank you. Hmmm, yes... Are you making sure to tailor your gifts to each of your neighbors' preferences? You can't just give ANY old thing as a gift. That's why you need to experiment and gauge the recipients' reactions. They'll be too shy to answer truthfully if you ask outright, but they're all honest people, so watch their faces...and that should make their true feelings clear. Take me right now, for instance. This gift? It's...okay.<wait>

My, my, my, now THIS is a problem. I don't like this at all. Of course, I'm not about to look a gift horse--or whatever this is--in the mouth since it came from you, but... I would really prefer to receive something that doesn't offend at least three of my senses, you know?<wait>

My, my, my. Care to explain what THIS is? I'll pull up a chair, so go ahead and prepare your explanation. I'm waiting. Now, I'm not about to REFUSE it, since it's coming from you, but other folks would no doubt be furious over this. Maybe you don't know this, but folks around here are fairly strait-laced, so be careful with pranks like this, hm?<wait>

Ahahaha! So, not only are you kind, but you're also pure as the driven snow, I see. Yes, yes, you're obviously taking a page out of Yu's book. But he's usually trying to scare me, not impress me. Even so, there aren't many small kids in this town, so I give them more leeway to fool around because it's cute.<wait>

Wow, that's a hard no from me, thanks! Did you purposefully choose to show me something I hate, or...? Ah, yes, of course. You couldn't have avoided this because you had no way of knowing. Well, now you do.<wait>
Whaaat?! This is for me? No no no, seriously! It's truly for me? Where did you--? Ohhh, I see! You had Saibara make it for you.<wait>
Guess he has more tricks up his sleeves than I thought. Then maybe I'll also ask him to-- What's that? I need to acquire a precious stone MYSELF to give to him?<wait>

Don't you think he charges a liiittle much if all he's doing is putting the thing together? Goodness, it's downright disgusting how arrogant some people can be about their own abilities. His son has been begging Saibara to move in with him, but he absolutely refuses to leave this town.<wait>
But all's well that ends well, I suppose. At least his grandson is living with him now.<wait>
Oh, my! Now THAT'S something right up my alley! Hm? You're giving it to me? Yesss! I'm tickled pink. Thank you. I never DREAMED someone would give me such a wonderful gift.<wait>

Oh, my! Is that for me? You're an odd duck, aren't you? I work at a Vineyard, so I use my nose to distinguish the scent of good grapes. Thus, I only use perfume when I go out. But I DO love this fragrance. If you were a suave, rugged bachelor, my heart points would have maxed out just now.<wait>

Oh, my! Is that for me? You're an odd duck, aren't you? I work at a Vineyard, so I use my nose to distinguish the scent of good grapes. Thus, I only use perfume when I go out. But I DO love this fragrance. Mm-mm-mmm! To die for. ♪<wait>

Oh, do you cook much, by any chance? I'll teach you how to make Mashed Potatoes. Are you ready? You'll need to memorize this. If you want to fetch something to write the recipe down on, that would be best. Go ahead, I'll wait. ...Hm? Do *I* have something? Oh, no, no. I love to talk, so I'll just tell you, all right? The main ingredients are Potatoes, Butter, and Milk. You'll also need a Pot, a Rolling Pin, and an Oven! Oh, and Seasonings, too. Heat the Potatoes in the Oven, crush them, and then mix them with the Butter and Milk. Are you sure you can remember all this without writing it down? ...No, I'm not making fun of you. Perish the thought! It's just that I said it so fast, I even surprised myself.<wait>

Oh, NO you didn't! Mm-mm! ...Aha. I see what's going on here. So, tell me. Who's the lucky so-and-so? Someone in this town, I assume? Right? Goodness, I simply CANNOT believe I hadn't caught wind of this sooner. Well, I suppose since you never breathed a word of it to me, I had absolutely no way of knowing. Speaking of which, are you trying for some kind of...cool cucumber vibe? You never actually SAY anything.<wait>

Listen to this, <playername>. Our daughter has started contacting us once a week, all on her own. Until now, it was always us trying to force some sort of communication out of her. This is all thanks to Sasha having a word with her, I'm sure. Oh, it is SO good to have friends in your corner.<wait>

Oh, my! Hello, hello, hello. ♪ How is <childname> doing, hmm? You seem to be gone quite a lot. Do you think children just sort of raise themselves without supervision? I suppose that's one approach you could take to parenting.<wait>

After all, even if the parents DO stick around, the child could one day up and skip town, like ours did. Children do whatever they please without a second thought as to how it affects their parents, you know.<wait>
You'll be fine, <playername>. With Cliff as your husband, <childname> is bound to be happy. I hope you'll keep taking good care of Cliff--and <childname> too, of course.<wait>
I haven't given up on Adge, either. I'm sure she'll come back home someday.<wait>
My, what a coincidence! Fancy running into you here. How's Cliff? What's he like at home, I wonder?<wait>
He's always been so overly considerate towards us that he ends up hiding how he really feels. Duke and I were just talking about that.<wait>

I'm sure he's comfortable enough to let his hair down around you--not that he has a ton. Do you ever get into fights? It's best NOT to fight, of course, but there's something a little eerie about couples who NEVER squabble, you know?<wait>
Oh dear, there I go again, off on another rant. Me and my big mouth!<wait>

Oh, <playername>. Hello there. How's the farm? Is it-- Are you-- Er. Slow down, Manna. One thought at a time. You know, to be honest, I'm actually heading to the Plaza right now, so I don't have time to chat. Sorry.<wait>
I decided to quit going to the Plaza to gossip on Saturdays. I know, who am I and what have I done with Manna? But it's much more fun chatting with Duke and Cliff at the Inn!<wait>

Oh, dear. I wonder if this'll keep up all day long. It's like I've got my own personal raincloud following me! I mean, I'm not making a groundbreaking statement here, but I can't be cooped up in the house all day. I'd go stir-crazy. No matter who I talk with on days like this, everyone spaces out. We have a dire shortage of good listeners.<wait>
Apparently, Cliff likes going to hear Carter proselytize at Church. Why in the world do you think that is? Personally, I can't understand a word that comes out of Carter's mouth.<wait>

He's apparently got a way of really captivating an audience, but I'm not so sure... In any case, Church doesn't exactly encourage ME to talk much, so I want to get it all out here while I still can.<wait>

I'm going to Anna's house right now. Sasha is always rushing me out the door, and Lillia has no patience for me, you know. Anna, on the other hand, always seems to look forward to my visits. There isn't anyone else like her in this town, so she's one of my favorite people to chat with.<wait>
Oh, is it that late already? Doesn't it feel like the days fly by? I swear, I blink and suddenly there's no time left for me to have a leisurely chat with Duke.<wait>

Oh, my. You're up early, <playername>. I suppose you can't very well sleep in when you work on a farm. Hmmm? You sometimes do anyway?! Heavens to homesteading, <playername>... No, no. I suppose that might be for the best in the end. After all, being TOO eager can backfire on you every so often. Trust me. I know from experience.<wait>

Oh, <playername>. You're still here? Well, as long as we're on the subject, you know who ELSE is an eager beaver? Ellen's granddaughter, Elly. She's an angel, but...how should I put this? She works too hard for someone her age, on top of trying to raise Yu. I feel so sorry for her! I notice Yu crying by himself a lot, too. They both have it so hard, poor things. Don't you think that's sad, <playername>?<wait>

Oh, my! Thanks. I know I don't talk to you much, <playername>, so it might be weird bringing this up, but... My daughter left me and this town behind, you know. Poof, just like that. And to top it all off, Duke-- Duke's my husband, in case you didn't know. Anyway, he goes out drinking every night, leaving me all alone.<wait>

To be honest, I've been lonely. That's why I try to talk to people as much as I can, just to take my mind off it. But the pain of not having your child around... It really can't be expressed in words. If she'd gone off to be someone's bride, that would be one thing, but... Oh, speaking of which, you came here on your own too, right, <playername>? Why'd you do that, anyway?<wait>

Oh, <playername>! Question: do you talk to Kai a lot? When he first came to this town, he was just a teenager, you know. He had Gotts--that's the old carpenter who lives on the mountain, just so you know--build him a small house. And up it went, smack dab in the middle of Mineral Beach.<wait>

And then, the very next day--get this--Kai painted the house this tacky white color! We all thought he was SO odd. There was a big stir when Carter came to town too, but Kai's way of talking really got under the other men's skin. If I said so much as a single kind word about Kai, I'd never hear the end of it from Duke! I tell you, men take pride in the most meaningless things... Who cares how someone talks?<wait>

Oh, <playername>. How's the farm? Speaking of farms, the youngest over at Yodel Ranch left quite a while back, just like our daughter did. Mind you, Mugi is a lot older than us, and all alone, too. And to top it all off, after ten whole years, Joanna finally-- Oh, that's Mugi's daughter, for the record. Anyway, Joanna finally came back, but with a little girl in tow! If I were Mugi, I'd have been flabbergasted! What's more, immediately after that, Joanna uproots herself once again and leaves Mineral Town in the dust. Here's the kicker to the whole story: that little girl Joanna brought? Our very own Mei. I feel so sorry for her.<wait>

Mugi has it hard too, you know. To this very day, he hasn't seen hide nor hair of Joanna.<wait><page> Mugi says that even if Joanna comes back for Mei, he'll refuse to let her take Mei away. Good for him, I say.<wait><page> I may not have any business chiming in as an outsider, but my heart just breaks for poor Mugi and Mei!<wait>
Oh, <playername>. How's the farm?<wait>

By the by, you don't know anything about Rod, do you, <playername>? He's Lillia's husband, and the one who came to Mineral Town with that shipper, Zack. They met on the road, and when Rod heard that Zack had no relatives and no job, he offered him free room and board. After a while, Zack found work as a shipper, and the rest is history. You know, before Zack arrived, a boat would only come to town once a month. He's been a real asset to the community.<wait>

But Lillia is so nice to Zack that he seems to have fallen head over heels for her. Except she's the wife of the guy who saved him. He won't give up, but he can't make a move, either. It's really quite sad. And Lillia, bless her heart, is so flaky that she doesn't have the first clue how Zack feels. Me? No, no, I could never tell her. I try not to rock the boat as much as possible, you know.<wait>

Oh, <playername>. Hello there. I'm chatting with Anna right now. Apparently, the place where Anna lived before coming here almost brushes shoulders with where my daughter is now. Doesn't that just make you so curious? I wonder what kind of life she's living.<wait>
Anna makes such decadent desserts! I always look forward to visiting her on Saturdays.<wait>
Oh, oh, listen to this! Today I just happened to overhear that...did... And THEN... So SHE said... Can you believe it?! Doesn't that just boggle your mind?!<wait>
...Mm.<wait>
Yes! You said it!<wait>
Oh, perish the thought! No, no, no. They're obviously...<wait>
Why, you ask? Well, let me tell you...<wait>
Yes, exactly. I mean, I've never heard of such a thing, and...<wait>
Oh, <playername>. Hello there. What's new? Hear any interesting rumors?<wait>
Listen to this! Duke racked up ANOTHER tab at the General Store! And for 5,000G, no less! What in the world did he buy that he kept completely secret from me?!<wait>

And what sort of racket is Jeff running in the first place? I'M the one who pays here. I wonder if it can even be returned? And you know what I heard from Dudley the other day? That Duke calls Adge basically every day. If he's going to spend that much on long-distance phone calls, he may as well go to see her. I mean, good grief.<wait>

Oh, hello, <playername>. Is <childname> sleeping? Once <childname> gets bigger, we can all have a meal together here. Wouldn't that be nice? Come to think of it, don't you think Cliff looks much happier now? Well, he IS a father now, after all. I suppose it's only natural he'd light up. Duke used to look exactly like that back when Adge was first born.<wait>

Now that <childname> is here, I suppose that makes me a grandma. It's such a strange feeling. Huh? You're surprised I feel that way? Regardless of ancestry, I think of you and <childname> as family. Don't you forget that.<wait>

Oh, hello, <playername>. Are you working right now? You're welcome to join us, if you like. I understand that you're busy, but it won't kill you to spend some time with your family every now and then. I won't force you, though.<wait>
I think of you as my daughter, <playername>. I have another daughter too, of course, which makes you her sister! If she ever comes back, I hope you two get along.<wait>
I think of you as my son, <playername>. I have a daughter too, of course, which makes you her brother! If she ever comes back, I hope you two get along.<wait>

Hello there, <playername>. Now that Cliff is with us, we've started coming to the Inn on Saturdays to have weekly meals together. After we finish eating, we always go to the Church. Aren't we the spitting image of a real family? Hahaha.<wait>

Duke has been so much happier since Cliff arrived. The same goes for me, of course, but... Days like this remind me of when Adge was around. Eating out with the family... Aah, it takes me back. Cliff is such a good guy that I can't help but fuss over him, you know.<wait>

Oh, you're here too, <playername>? What about <childname>? Establishing healthy habits should be a priority, both for you and your family. Kids deserve the chance to be kids. You should bring <childname> here sometime. Carter said he wants to see mini-Cliff too.<wait>
Ever since <childname> was born, Duke and I haven't been fighting as much. It's like his prickly exterior has all but melted away. I suppose you aren't at that point in your relationship yet.<wait>

Cliff certainly is fond of Carter. Because Carter supported him the most when he first arrived in town, Cliff goes to Church every week without fail. I've heard him speak a number of times now, and he's a pretty fascinating man. Have you heard his sermons, <playername>? Churches are only as good as their priests, and we lucked out.<wait>
If a person puts their mind to it, they can become whoever and whatever their heart desires. So much has changed since I met Cliff. My worldview, my lifestyle...<wait>

Cliff is such a serious guy. I've decided not to pry into his past and let him speak for himself instead. It broke my heart when I heard from Carter how terribly hurt Cliff was and how often he came to Church. I want to try and be a surrogate mother to him. It's the least I can do. Duke told me that if Cliff says he likes the Vineyard, then he's thinking about taking him in. I'm sure Duke still loves our daughter more than anything, but... I also feel like life can't continue the way it has been. We've stagnated. And I've had enough.<wait>
You have to be quiet in Church, you know.<wait>

Do you know that girl named Jennifer? She lives at the Inn, but she's a bit of an oddball, let me tell you. Apparently, she used to be an aristocrat or something, but she got tired of having her life dictated and ran away. To be honest--and this is just me--I would've been perfectly happy living a life of wealth and luxury. Just saying... This conversation reminds me of my daughter, actually. I wonder what she's doing right now.<wait>

Hey, did you know that Brandon is apparently a famous artist? It turns out that there are good art-making materials in the mountains around here. That's why he came to town. The story goes that Gotts found him collapsed in the mountains. Collapsed! Can you imagine? One thing led to another, and now he's freeloading at Gotts' mountain shack. But what kind of art does he even make? I'd like to see his work sometime.<wait>
That girl Jennifer says there's a Goddess living in the mountain by this town. According to her, a bunch of fairies live here too. Yeah, sure, Jen. Talk about having a few screws loose.<wait>

Have you seen any of Brandon's art, <playername>? Word is, he's made quite a name for himself in the art world. His pieces are very avant-garde, or so I've heard. Something tells me his work would go right over my head.<wait>
You know about the Mochi Bonanza, don't you? Of course you do, the town's abuzz about it. I can't help out much with the preparations, but with the mochi-eating? You know I'll be there!<wait>
Every time Derby season rolls around, Duke can't seem to sit still. We've been together for years, but I still get a kick out of it.<wait>
I enjoy watching the horses as much as everyone else in this town, though! So I'll be going, too, of course.<wait>
We've had some especially tasty morsels in Cooking Exhibitions past. I'm sure this year's will be just as scrumptious!<wait>
"Do I have confidence in my culinary skill?" What kind of question is that, silly? Of course I do!<wait>
The Harvest Festival's in a few days! I'm still deciding what kind of ingredients to bring!<wait>
Well, <playername>, I've just GOT to know what you'll be bringing to the Harvest Festival! I'm sure you have plenty of produce from your farm to share with us, hm?<wait>
Oh, goodness, another year gone already? But I don't WANT to age another year...<wait>
Aha, so you have brought it. Very good. Allow me to show you my most superlative wares.<wait>
Oh? Your Bag is full, I'm afraid. You'll have to sort that out before you buy any of my wares.<wait>
Master Shopper Award
All Letters
All Books
Remote Control
Mystery Flower
All BGM
Quiz Book
Van's Favorite

...Or so I WOULD say, but it would appear that you presently cannot afford even my least expensive commodity.<wait><page> Piteous indeed. I suppose we'll have to wait until you've saved up a little more. At least 1,000,000G should do.<wait>
Today's special item is...TA-DAAAH! "<string0>." It will cost you <string1>G.<wait>
Aha. A most familiar item indeed.<wait><page> If you have at least 1,000,000G to spare, I can show you another of my wares.<wait>
Will you buy this item?<wait>
Yes! Money is no object!
Not at THAT price!
Thank you for your business.<wait>

I see. A pity.<wait><page> Bear in mind that the next time you drop by, I may have a different item available for sale.<wait><page> So please, go ahead and bring me the exact same thing again then.<wait>
Oh ho! And on my birthday, too.<wait>
Great gilded goddess of gift-giving, this is a most valuable item indeed! I will cherish it.<wait>
A present? For me? Thank you. I shall keep it close.<wait>
Erm, I'm afraid I'm...not particularly fond of this, but I appreciate the thought nonetheless. Thank you.<wait>
What manner of tasteless japery...?! I've no need of something so worthless!<wait>
Oh, what a precious little thing! Hahahaha!<wait>
YIKES! I'll kindly ask you to put some distance between me and THAT, please!<wait>
Oh ho! A quality item indeed, that. Hm? It is a present for me?<wait><page> Why, thank you.<wait>
Aah, now THIS is quite the treasure. Hm? It is a present for me? Thank you.<wait>
What a luxurious fragrance! Why, if opulence had a scent...!<wait><page> Hm? It is for me? How very kind.<wait>
Aha, that's right. Today is the holiday wherein chocolate is exchanged.<wait>
A lovely feather, that. I'm sure it would fetch a handsome price on the market.<wait><page> Hm? It is a symbolic token exchanged during a marriage proposal? I see! Congratulations to you, then.<wait>

Word is that an unassuming little farm in Forgotten Valley by the name of <linkedfarmname> is highly profitable.<wait><page> Personally, I believe the owner must be up to some manner of shenanigans on the side if they are making THAT much money.<wait>
I've half a mind to travel to Forgotten Valley before long.<wait>
Forgotten Valley is quite the interesting place. I may go visit it again soon.<wait>
I do believe I'll travel to Forgotten Valley again in the near future.<wait>
Is something the matter?<wait>
I have a wide variety of rare and luxuriant curios for sale.<wait>
My travels to far-flung locales have supplied me with all manner of rare regional goods.<wait>

When I happen upon an unusual item, I find myself almost compelled to buy it on the spot.<wait><page> I suppose my desire to collect the wonders of this world must be embedded in my very nature. Hahaha.<wait>
One of the regions I visit most is Forgotten Valley. It is a peaceful and pleasant place.<wait>
I highly encourage you to visit someday, <playername>. I'm willing to bet top dollar you'd find it agreeable.<wait>

I have been to many places. I have met many people and seen many things. But of all the myriad places I have been...<wait><page> Mineral Town ranks among my favorites. Such kind people and lush environs. Forgotten Valley is a close second.<wait>
You know, I think I'd like to stay here in this town for as long as I can.<wait>

Hello there! You are <playername>, correct?<wait><page> My name is Harris. It's my honor to be the constable of Mineral Town.<wait><page> Our community is as serene as it is crime-free, so don't worry. You will be perfectly safe here.<wait>
Thank you!<wait><page> What an honor it is to have the townsfolk I serve celebrate my birthday like this. I'm a lucky man indeed.<wait>
Thank you! And not just for the lovely gift, but for even thinking of me in the first place.<wait>
Thank you! I appreciate your thoughtfulness.<wait>
Thank you.<wait>
Erm, w-well... Your heart was certainly in the right place...<wait>
I admit to feeling disappointed--not out of greediness, but because I didn't think you capable of being so hurtful.<wait>
Hahaha! How cute! Little critters like this one really are adorable, aren't they?<wait>
Erm, I'm sorry. I, ah... I admit it! I'm scared of those!<wait>

Once upon a time, in a land not unlike our own, there was a normal family. The kind one would find anywhere.<wait>

A father, mother, and their juvenile son all lived together in blissful harmony.<wait><page> One day, the mother succumbed to a virulent illness and suddenly passed away.<wait><page> As the grief-stricken father stood over his late wife, the little boy came up to him, and asked:<wait><page> "What happened to Mom?" The boy curiously peered at his dearly departed mother's unblinking face.<wait><page> The father, unsure what to say, desperately explained that she had fallen into a deep sleep.<wait>
Upon hearing that, the boy was greatly troubled. He told his father:<wait><page> "Then please, Dad. Use all of my allowance and buy a big alarm clock to wake her up."<wait>
What do you think of that?<wait>
That was when the father learned that the diluted words adults use to avoid speaking of death...<wait><page> ...hold neither power over nor meaning to children.<wait>
Think on that. I bid you a blessed day.<wait>

Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there lived a beautiful girl.<wait><page> Her hair was black as ebony, her skin as white as snow, and her lips as red as blood.<wait><page> The girl's mother, a witch, had in her possession a magical mirror. One day, she asked the mirror:<wait>
"Magic mirror on the wall, who is the fairest of them all?" The mirror replied:<wait><page> "Of course, it is you, my queen." The witch smirked in satisfaction.<wait>

If the mirror had said any name but her own, she would have sent her servants to expunge them from the earth.<wait><page> And if the servants were to fail in their solemn duty, she would poison that person with her own two hands.<wait>
In truth, the mirror knew that the ebony-haired girl was the fairest of them all, but feared the price of honesty.<wait><page> And so, it lied. Everyone lived happily ever after. The end.<wait>
What do you think? That story is called "Snow-White Lies." Mull that over until we next meet.<wait>

This is a true story that takes place before I became a priest.<wait><page> Once, I was penniless and lived out my days in a small apartment.<wait><page> From my apartment window, when the curtains were drawn, I could see into the building right across from mine.<wait><page> The room I could see was just as gloomy as mine. Eventually, I learned that a married couple lived there.<wait>

The wife would leave for work each day while the husband remained behind. I assumed he was some sort of artist.<wait><page> At least, that's what I thought at first, until I noticed something odd.<wait>

Whenever I looked into their living space, he was always squatting in the exact same position.<wait><page> From then on, I found myself paying much more attention to that room across the way.<wait><page> The husband remained in the exact same place and posture from when the curtains opened to when they closed at night.<wait><page> But he was not motionless. I could see him talking and moving his head.<wait><page> Fixated upon this man I had never met, I became desperate to learn the reason why.<wait><page> One day, a small fire broke out in that apartment. My gaze hovered over their open window.<wait><page> And what did I find but the husband squatting in his usual place, a troubled expression etched upon his face.<wait><page> I knew the wife had left for the day, so I scrambled over to help the husband.<wait><page> By the time I arrived, the room was filled with smoke, but I could see him turning toward me.<wait><page> Running to his side, I laid my hands upon him, ready to forcibly drag him out...<wait><page> ...but despite his weedy appearance--surely he would be as light as paper, I told myself--his body was stone-heavy.<wait><page> That was when my eyes traveled downward...and saw four hands jutting from the floor, holding him in place.<wait>
"Aaaaaagh!"<wait>
Phew... Even now, remembering the horror I felt in that moment still gives me goosebumps.<wait>
Cliff has left the town.<wait><page> We are all the masters of our own destinies. He has to decide for himself to change his circumstances.<wait>
And sometimes people just run out of money. Unfortunately, that is one problem I cannot help with.<wait>
Cliff has changed since he married you. His spirit is lighter. I can see it in his face.<wait>
Cliff has changed since he married you. His spirit is lighter. I can see it in his face.<wait>
In the end, you're the one who saved Cliff.<wait><page> Since coming here, I've realized what amazing power lies within the bonds of human connection.<wait>
